attributes.action: reduce the burden of debt on students and graduates by restructuring the interest rates so that those who have to borrow the most pay the least interest.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As things stand currently, a student completing a four year master course or similar and having to borrow the maximum student loan (which is mostly used for rent!) will leave university with a debt of over £18,000! The new interest rate of 4.8% makes this debt a crippling one, and is unacceptable. The interest rates if any, should be staggered so that the larger debts naturally incurred by the needier students, attract less interest, etc., on a sliding scale. This makes sense if it's not possible to scrap loans and interest entirely, and is much more ethical than the current blanket approach of high interest across the board!
